verbs.description: [ARG1: Senator Bob Corker ( R - TN )] [V: blew] up [ARGM-LOC: on the Senate floor] , [ARGM-ADV: blasting his fellow Republicans for being too afraid of president Donald Trump to bring tough legislation to the upper chamber of Congress . Corker began his fusillade by firing shots at Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell , noting that in the past year and a half the chamber had brought very few amendments to the floor . Instead] , he suggested , McConnell keeps blocking bills out of fear of how President Donald Trump may view them .
